Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tonight the Scranton Business Park is having Casino Night and we are converting our warehouse into a full-blown gambling hall. And I know it's illegal in Pennsylvania, but it's for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer. It's just... It's nice to know at the end of the day, I can look in the mirror and say, "Michael, because of you, some little kid in the Congo has a belly full of rice this evening." Makes you feel good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Excuse me. How long is the wait for a table for two?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would never, ever serve you. Not in a million, billion years.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know. It belonged to my grandfather. He was buried in it, so family heirloom.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So, what's the deal? We gotta pay for our own drinks? That's lame.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on, it'll be fun, and besides, I'm a roulette expert.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible. Roulette is not a game of skill, it is a game of chance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can always kind of win at roulette.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] You can't be serious. Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ever since I was a little kid, like, eight or nine, I could sort of control things with my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was just little thing, you know, like I could make something shake or I could make a marble fall off the counter. You know, just little things.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] That's ridiculous. You know what? Uh... Why don't you move that coat rack? Excuse me, everyone! Attention in the office, please. Jim is about to prove his telekinetic powers and he needs absolute silence. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll try. [The coat rack wobbles] [Pam holds up an umbrella handle to the camera in another scene]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I try not to think of it as lagging behind. It's more of a David-and-Goliath thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah, but... Well, the fact of the matter is that your branch is currently number four of the five branches that I oversee.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know that I'm very serious here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan, listen, I promise that I will kick it up a notch. Bam!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Emeril. Oh, actually, while I have you, not that I have you or have ever had you, but we're having our Casino Night tonight and I think everyone would love to see their fearless leader here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I thought that you were their fearless leader.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am, but you are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think you can handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, it'd be fun. I can hear it in your voice. You need a break.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan and I understand each other. The romance thing is sort of on hold for the time being, but we've remained good friends. Good friends with privileges. Not now, some day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody. Tonight's event is to benefit the Boy Scouts of America.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Again? We do that every year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, they need our money. They don't have cookies like the Girl Scouts.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It'd be nice to do something for people who are actually suffering.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Oscar, if you don't like it, then you should concentrate on winning. Because the person at the end of the evening with the highest chip count will receive $500 to donate to the charity of their choice. And they will get a mini-fridge compliments of Vance Refrigeration.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So get your charities in to Pam. I, for example, am playing for Comic Relief.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Comedy is very much alive, as are homeless people.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, they stopped making that show.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then, they need our money more than ever.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You have to pick an approved, non-profit organization.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: There's a great soup kitchen in downtown Scranton. Delicious pea soup on Thursdays. I'll probably give the money to them.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Kobe Bryant has a foundation, and he is so hot. And he gave his wife the biggest diamond ring. I know he didn't do it. ...Maybe he did it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We are giving money that has been gambled. Why don't we just deal drugs or prostitute ourselves, and donate that money to charity?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, and another fun thing. We, at the end of the night, are going to give the check to an actual group of Boy Scouts. Right, Toby? We're gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Actually, I didn't think it was appropriate to invite children since it's... You know, there's gambling and alcohol, and it's in our dangerous warehouse and it's a school night... And, you know, Hooters is catering. You know, is that enough? Should I keep going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are you the way that you are? Honestly, every time I try to do something fun or exciting, you make it not... that way. I hate so much about the things that you choose to be. Okay, you know what? I will not donate my winnings to Comic Relief, since apparently it doesn't exist. I am going to donate to Afghanistanis with AIDS.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you mean the aid to Afghanistan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I mean Afghanistanis with AIDS.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? No. No. AIDS is not funny. Believe me, I have tried.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are certain topics that are off-limits to comedians, JFK, AIDS, the Holocaust. The Lincoln Assassination just recently became funny. "I need to see this play like I need a hole in the head." [laughs] And I hope to someday live in a world where a person could tell a hilarious AIDS joke. It's one of my dreams.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy was supposed to pick the band, but he's concentrating more on the bachelor party now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, where you going? I mean, even if you don't hire a band, you still have to watch the bands. Pam, these are people who have never given up on their dreams. I have great respect for that. And, yes, they're all probably very bad and that will make me feel better about not having dreams.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's a KISS cover band in here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm pretty happy these days. I'm getting married soon and I'm getting along with everybody at work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why did I talk to Jan about transferring? Well, you know... I have no future here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have already put down the deposit. Do you understand how a deposit works?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, I am not having fire-eaters in a paper warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's Casino Night like Las Vegas. There are fire-eaters all over the place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually, it's owned by Beakman Properties, and Dunder Mifflin is four years into a seven-year lease.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When Darryl was coming, you said you wanted me here for protection.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We just have a lot of stuff down there that could be stolen.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I taught Mike some, uh, phrases to help with his interracial conversations. You know, stuff like, "Fleece it out." "Going mach five." "Dinkin' flicka." You know, things us Negroes say.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me some. [Michael and Darryl perform simultaneous hand gesture]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, I taught him a handshake, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim ejects a videotape from the VCR and puts in a new one] Wow. I don't know how you're gonna decide. They are all extremely good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think I should hire them all. Do like Lollapalooza.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your mom would love that. She would. Oh, this band is called Scrantonicity.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wait. That's Kevin. On the drums.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: On the drums! On the drums!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, that's Kevin! Great song, Kev. Oh, my God, he's the drummer and the singer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We really don't do a lot of weddings. We actually don't play in public very often. We are all really hoping that Pam's wedding works out. This could be a turning point for the band.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, you haven't seen that since 1983. That is amazing. Okay, we have to sign him. I'm gonna call the label, we're gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Pam, you're gonna lose him to another wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, come back! No, no, no!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim is great. Being with him just takes away all the stress of planning my wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Michael, Carol Stills for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I know a Carol Stills?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, put her through. Hey Carol, how goes the real estate biz? Is it real good?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes I don't put Michael through until he's already said something. I look at it as a practice run for him. He usually does better on the second attempt.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I'm great. I just needed one last signature for your mortgage insurance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, no problemo. Incidentally, I love the place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great. It has a little bit of a weird smell. It's okay. At Christmas, the tree helped.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Oh, good, I'm glad. Can I drop it over later?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, I'm sort of hosting this charity thing in our warehouse, Casino Night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it'll be good. You know what? Why don't you come by? Bring the papers, I'll sign them and then you can stay and have a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. It'll be fun. What do you...[phone rings] What do you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Could you hold on? Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, put her through. [Deep voice] Jan Levinson, I presume?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's still me. Uh, Jan, here's Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know, I... I thought about it and you are right.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I could use a little fun. So, I am going to drive up for your Casino Night.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, then. I will see you tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye Hello, Carol? Hi, sorry about that. I just...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: I have to get a sitter, but that shouldn't be a problem.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: And I'll bring the papers, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Two queens on Casino Night. I am going to drop a deuce on everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [People playing casino games as the actual Casino Night begins] Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Thanks. Thank you for inviting me. It looks so great in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well... Kiss. [Michael kisses her on the cheek, pauses and then kisses her on the other cheek] That's how we do it in the paper biz. It's European and... Yes? Ah, Dwight [Kisses cheeks]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Code name Re/Max is here. No sign of Lan Jevinson.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm Michael's wingman. I've got his back. Two dates. He's got two dates tonight. My job is to keep Jan away from Carol and vice versa. Michael said, "We must deceive them, so as not to hurt them, and in that way, we honor them."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I get you a drink? The food is from Hooters.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, I steal things all the time. It's just something I do. I stopped caring a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I've taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things.

Quote.Speaker: Billy's Girlfriend
Quote.Text: I'm gonna get a drink. Do you need anything?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your nurse became your girlfriend? Sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Billy
Quote.Text: She was never my nurse. I met her at Chili's. She was my waitress.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welkommen, Bienvenue, and welcome to Monte Carlo! Dwight. I am no longer your boss. Lady Fortune is your boss.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [Under his breath] Will Lady Fortune give me a raise?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut it, shut it, shut it. Will Lady Fortune be your mistress? Only time will tell, my friends. Leave all your preconceived notions about casinos at the door. Old friends, new lovers, and the disabled! Welcome all! Great, okay. Shuffle up and deal. Let's get it started! Black-Eyed Crows.

Quote.Speaker: Dealer
Quote.Text: Okay, the game is No-Limit Texas Hold'em. Good luck, everybody. That's at least four red chips to you, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bluffing is a key part of poker, which is too bad, because I'm not very good at bluffing. Did you believe me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Toby, I went all-in on the first hand, so doesn't that tell you that I might have good cards, too? So don't be stupid. Just take it back.

Quote.Speaker: Dealer
Quote.Text: No, I'm sorry. He can't, sir. He's gone all-in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You really screwed that up. [Michael leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't really play cards, but I'm not gonna lie to you. It felt really good to take money from Michael. Gonna chase that feeling.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I expect to do very well tonight. I have an acute ability to read people. Jim, for instance, has a huge tell. When he gets a good hand, he coughs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [coughs] I will raise. [Dwight sighs and folds his cards] Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's the weirdest thing. Every time I cough, he folds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, whatever. Hey, you know what? If luck weren't involved, I would always be winning. [Sees Jan] Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, okay, I think we're all adults here, and it has always been my understanding that we have an open relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you... Just... Wait, what're you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: After you said you weren't coming, I invited Carol to come and I don't think that I did anything wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Jan. I'm Michael's boss.

Quote.Speaker: Billy
Quote.Text: It's all on you, baby. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good evening, Dwight. What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Evening, Angela. This is craps. I need to roll an eight. If I do, everyone wins.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah! Yeah! [Kisses Angela, she slaps him and walks away smiling]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dwight, let's keep it going. Let's keep it going. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Let it ride. Let it all ride.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mhmm, And I'm gonna take you all-in.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think she's full of it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam. Jim Halpert, ladies and gentlemen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you very much. It was fun.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Can I get a red wine? So, two hours? That's a long drive.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, it's part of the job, you know? Keep an eye on things. So... Why not? So, how long have you and Michael been...

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Oh, well, actually, I guess this would be our first date. I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Casino Night in the warehouse. Good sport.

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: Well, I'm having a nice time.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: One beer and one Seven and Seven with eight maraschino cherries, sugar on the rim, blended if you can.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, that's still going on, huh? You and Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Dealer
Quote.Text: The point is four. Shooter, roll it. Four!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Four! [Holds dice in front of Carol] Blow. Blow for luck! Yeah! Also, you. Not playing favorites. [Holds dice in front of Jan] All right, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. [Turns to Jan] So where you staying? Radisson?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Holiday Inn? The Hyatt in Wilkes-Barre? You staying with Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I won the 2002 $2,500 No-Limit Deuce-to-Seven-Draw Tournament at the World Series of Poker in Vegas. So, yeah... I'm pretty good at poker.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you, Bobby. But it doesn't matter, it's just fun to play.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Look, I won! Look I have all the clovers! You wanna play again?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I do not want to talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, I saw your tape. Your band, Scrantonicity? You guys rock.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, you guys wanna play our wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Awesome. Did Pam say it was okay?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Whatever. I'm in charge of the music.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dude, you will not be sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Fabulous time. I drove two and a half hours to get here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Left work early, drove down here. And I am completely underdressed

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I think you look great.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why did I hook up with Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was very late, Jim. Very... Very late and... Have you given any more thought to the transfer?

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Excuse me. Big moment. The evening's chip leader and winner of this beautiful mini-refrigerator courtesy of Vance Refrigeration, Creed Bratton, Dunder Mifflin!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Thanks. I never owned a refrigerator.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Sorry, babe. I am just beat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's okay. I'll see you at home.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Okay. Hey, don't try to lose too much money, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: If you still want a honeymoon. Hey, Halpert. Keep an eye on her, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good, especially after I took all your money in poker.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Hey, can I talk to you about something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: About when you want to give me more of your money?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you wanna do that now? We can go inside. I'm feeling kind of good tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was just... I'm in love with you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry if that's weird for you to hear, but I needed you to hear it. Probably not good timing, I know that. I just...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you doing? What do you expect me to say to that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just needed you to know. Once.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I um... I... I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on. I don't wanna do that. I wanna be more than that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't. I'm really sorry if you misinterpreted things. It's probably my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not your fault. I'm sorry I misinterpreted our friendship.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, I just wanted to congratulate you on a fantastic evening. You did the company proud.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And thanks for inviting me. You were right, I needed it. So, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And you guys have a good time together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good night. She's a good boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Love triangle. Drama. All worked out in the end, though. The hero got the girl. Who saw that coming? I did. And Jan was really happy for me. So actually the hero got two girls. He got the girl that he works with and he got the girl that he buys real estate from. So, I've got my New York girl and my local flavor. Life is good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [On phone] About 10 minutes ago. No, I didn't know what to say. Yes, I know. Um, I don't know, mom, he's my best friend. Yeah, he's great. Yeah, I think I am. [Jim enters] I have to go. I will. Listen, Jim... [They kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, in the conference room now, please. Thank you. Time is money.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Should I get water or donuts?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, let's go. Take a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want somebody to give me the name of one of our biggest competitors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Yes, that will work. All right. Now I need a plural noun. [All groaning]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Apparently Michael has come up with a Dunder Mifflin Mad Lib, and he's making us play it with him. We are so happy. No. I'd like to choose a different adjective.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I am going back to my desk...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. No, no, not until you give me an adjective.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Toby, damn it, come on! We already have that. I need something fun. Something like fat or smelly. Or pukey. Pukey. Pukey's good. Okay. Pukey. Now I need a noun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Thank you, Phyllis. That wasn't so hard. All right, here we go. "Office Depot is an annoying store. One day Creed went there to buy paper. And he ran into irritating Cylons."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "One of them was named Michael Scott, and he was an..." Oh, damn it. Okay. Okay, okay, we're... Okay, we're starting over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My charity is the Farm Defense Fund. It's one of the best organizations that fights infestation of the beet armyworm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My charity is the Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff's Department, because Dwight's a Volunteer Sheriff. So I thought this was a perfect opportunity to support/mock him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't believe that Jim moved that coat rack. But if he did, he has an obligation to use his gift wisely. With great power comes great responsibility. They could do a cross-section of his brain to find out more. But I don't think it's true, though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, if anything goes missing, we will reimburse.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. Can Dunder Mifflin afford that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dang! Paper making paper, I.e. money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Paper money. [clears throat] Yeah. The company's doing fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, we're not shipping as much as we did last year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Okay. You know what? Don't even think. I command you to just go down and have fun tonight. All right? Don't think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Our numbers are down, yes, but we have a heck of a crew here in Scranton. Hardworking, motivated, dynamic. Every single last one of them. They follow my lead. I sort of set the tone. And it doesn't hurt that my ex works for corporate. Jan loves this branch, and I think that's really more than half the battle.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It is extremely stressful, planning a wedding by yourself. It's like a job. I mean, it's fun, but it kind of becomes like work. I've already planned it all out in my head. But it's just in my head.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, God. Oh, no. I have this problem all the time. I never remember people I've had sex with.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith's Vet
Quote.Text: And we had sex in the parking lot.
